clinical_study.brief_title: Biomechanically Compatible,Minimally Invasive Technique for Recurrence Free Groin Hernia Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Former Chairman Department of Surgery St.Joseph Mercy Oakland Pontiac Former Clinical Associate Professor Surgery Wayne State University,Detroit

brief_summary.textblock: "A bio-mechanically compatible, minimally invasive technique for recurrence-free groin hernia repair by implantation of Tensiflex mesh prosthesis for the enhancement of the tissue tensile strength of the fascia transversalis."

detailed_description.textblock:
Hernia recurrences post-repair remain a confounding problem. The prospective study described herein tested Cooper's paradigm, which holds that abdominal pressure exceeding abdominal wall resistance causes hernia, by incorporating the Tensiflex mesh prosthesis which is a modified version of mesh prosthesis of Stoppa technique in the surgical treatment of patients with hernia. The study was 2-phased: the first phase involved the pre-peritoneal implantation of a bi-layered mesh for anatomical replacement of the damaged fascia. The second phase involved the implantation of the bi-layered Tensiflex mesh prosthesis for definitive and seamless augmentation of tensile strength in the myopectineal orifice of Fruchaud.
Eighty-three percent of our patients consumed analgesics for 3 days (3% reported no pain on day 3); however, by day 5, 86% reported pain intensity scores lower than 5. The median number of lost workdays was 7. Most importantly, the primary endpoint of 100% recurrence-free outcomes was met, as were the secondary endpoints (minimal pain, morbidity, and loss of workdays).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All patients with confirmed inguinal hernias of all types

primary_outcome.description: The prospective study of 486 patients includes implantation of the specially designed Tensiflex mesh prosthesis in117 patients for seamless augmentation of the tensile strength,has rendered 100% recurrence free oucomes.

arm_group.description: The tensile strength of the orifice of Frauchad was augmented by implantation of a Accordion fold shaped prosthesis.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Phase 2:Curative implantation of a custom designed bio-mechanically compatible Tensiflex prosthesis
arm_group.description: The wing shaped custom designed tensiflex prosthesis in the groin was impanted as a curative technique since it provided seamless augmenation of the tensile tissue strength.

intervention.arm_group_label: Phase 2:Curative implantation of a custom designed bio-mechanically compatible Tensiflex prosthesis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients with confirmed groin hernia of both sexes.
Exclusion Criteria:
- none

responsible_party.investigator_title: Former Chairman of surgery St. Joseph Mercy Oakland Hospital
